info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 5:55PM MST until December 24 at 6:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST SATURDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO NOON MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...The Continental Divide along the Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM MST Saturday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 6 AM Saturday to Noon MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
